Package com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest

Class HttpServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest.HttpServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public final class HttpServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    A simplified wrapper for an embedded test HTTP server.

    See com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest for more details and examples.

    The server can be configured with any implementation of Handler to specify how HTTP requests should be handled. However, this is limited to behavior that is valid in HTTP. If you want to simulate a server that does not return a valid HTTP response, use TcpServer instead.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  HttpServer.Delegate
      An abstraction for the part of the server implementation that could vary by platform.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void close()
      Shuts down the server.
      int getPort()
      Returns the server's port.
      RequestRecorder getRecorder()
      Returns the RequestRecorder that receives all requests to this server, unless you disable it with RequestRecorder.setEnabled(boolean).
      java.net.URI getUri()
      Returns the server's base URI.
      java.net.URL getUrl()
      Returns the server's base URI.
      static HttpServer start​(int port, Handler handler)
      Starts a new test server on a specific port.
      static HttpServer start​(Handler handler)
      Starts a new test server on any available port.
      static HttpServer startSecure​(ServerTLSConfiguration tlsConfig, int port, Handler handler)
      Starts a new HTTPS test server on a specific port.
      static HttpServer startSecure​(ServerTLSConfiguration certData, Handler handler)
      Starts a new HTTPS test server on any available port.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static HttpServer start​(int port,
                               Handler handler)
        Starts a new test server on a specific port.
        Parameters:
        port - the port to listen on
        handler - An object or lambda that will handle all requests to this server. Use the factory methods in Handlers for standard handlers. If you will need to change the behavior of the handler during the lifetime of the server, use HandlerSwitcher.
        Returns:
        the started server instance

      • start

        public static HttpServer start​(Handler handler)
        Starts a new test server on any available port.
        Parameters:
        handler - An object or lambda that will handle all requests to this server. Use the factory methods in Handlers for standard handlers. If you will need to change the behavior of the handler during the lifetime of the server, use HandlerSwitcher.
        Returns:
        the started server instance

      • startSecure

        public static HttpServer startSecure​(ServerTLSConfiguration tlsConfig,
                                     int port,
                                     Handler handler)
        Starts a new HTTPS test server on a specific port.
        Parameters:
        tlsConfig - certificate and key data; to use a self-signed certificate, call ServerTLSConfiguration.makeSelfSignedCertificate()
        port - the port to listen on
        handler - An object or lambda that will handle all requests to this server. Use the factory methods in Handlers for standard handlers. If you will need to change the behavior of the handler during the lifetime of the server, use HandlerSwitcher.
        Returns:
        the started server instance
